item.title: Bank of America tops estimates on better-than-expected net interest income, equities trading
item.description: Bank of America, the second-largest U.S. bank by assets, has been a beneficiary of the industry's recent tail winds.

item.title: Citigroup tops estimates on stronger net interest income, smaller loan loss provision
item.description: Under CEO Jane Fraser, Citigroup is in the midst of a restructuring, selling off parts of its overseas operations.

item.title: Warren Buffett was still searching for that elephant to buy in his final months as Berkshire CEO
item.description: Warren Buffett, who handed over the CEO reins to Greg Abel at the start of 2026, made it clear that size is not the constraint, opportunity is.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Wells Fargo, Bank of America, Netflix & more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in premarket trading.

item.title: Alibaba-backed PixVerse launches real-time AI video tool, top executive tells CNBC
item.description: Co-founder Jaden Xie told CNBC that the company is about to close another financing round, after raising $100 million in the last 6 months.
